title: New boss defends role of audit watchdog ahead of planned scrapping
text:
The new head of the City’s accounting watchdog has insisted it can leave the past behind after widespread criticism over its role in a string of high-profile company collapses.

Sir Jon Thompson, the new chief executive of the Financial Reporting Council (FRC), said the organisation has “the ability to make a fundamental difference to the UK economy” despite facing major criticism over accounting scandals at companies including Carillion and Patisserie Valerie.

The FRC was blasted last year in a damning report by former civil servant Sir John Kingman, who said it was not fit for purpose and had failed to keep accountants in check.
